Complete Blood Count (CBC): Leukopenia (low white blood cell count), thrombocytopenia (low platelet count), anemia (low red blood cell count) due to bone marrow suppression.
Liver Function Tests (ALT, AST, ALP, Bil: Elevated liver enzymes or bilirubin, indicating hepatotoxicity.
Renal Function Tests (Creatinine, BUN): Elevated creatinine and blood urea nitrogen (BUN), indicating nephrotoxicity.
Serum Electrolytes (Potassium, Magnesium: Hyperkalemia (high potassium), hypomagnesemia (low magnesium), and hypernatremia (high sodium) depending on the drug.
C-Reactive Protein (CRP): Reduced levels due to suppression of immune and inflammatory responses.
Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR): Decreased levels due to suppression of inflammation.
Trough Drug Levels: Abnormal therapeutic drug levels (e.g., cyclosporine, tacrolimus, or sirolimus) affecting efficacy or toxicity.
Blood Glucose: Hyperglycemia, potentially leading to steroid-induced diabetes or due to calcineurin inhibitors.
Lipid Profile (Cholesterol, Triglyceride: Elevated cholesterol and triglycerides, increasing cardiovascular risk.
Serum Immunoglobulins (IgG, IgA, IgM): Reduced levels due to suppression of B-cell function.
Urinalysis: Proteinuria or hematuria, indicating renal involvement or dysfunction.
Bone Density (DEXA Scan): Decreased bone mineral density, indicating osteoporosis or osteopenia with prolonged corticosteroid use.
Serum Uric Acid: Elevated levels, potentially leading to gout.
Direct Antiglobulin Test (DAT/Coombs Tes: Positive in cases of drug-induced hemolytic anemia.
Serum LDH: Elevated levels in cases of hemolysis or cellular damage.
CMV PCR (Cytomegalovirus Polymerase Chai: Elevated viral load, indicating reactivation or infection due to immunosuppression.
EBV PCR (Epstein-Barr Virus Polymerase C: Elevated levels, increasing the risk of post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder (PTLD).
Parathyroid Hormone (PTH): Elevated levels in chronic kidney disease or bone metabolism disorders.
Serum Calcium and Phosphate: Abnormal levels due to bone metabolism disturbances.
